etymology.description: Depicts a sprout emerging from the ground
etymology.interpretation: The character 屮(屮) (chè, 'sprout') visually represents a young plant or sprout emerging upwards, emphasizing new growth or beginnings.

examples.chinese: 春风拂过山花旁(春風拂過山花旁)，一个小屮萌生新绿(一個小屮萌生新綠)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnfēng fúguò shānhuā páng, yīgè xiǎo chè méngshēng xīn lǜ.
examples.english: A gentle spring breeze caresses the mountain flowers, and a little sprout begins to show its new green.

examples.chinese: 阳光普照屮生无限希望(陽光普照屮生無限希望)。
examples.pinyin: Yángguāng pǔzhào chè shēng wúxiàn xīwàng.
examples.english: Sunshine makes the sprout grow with infinite hope.
